entry.title: Chrome for Testing: `--disable-infobars` should only disable informational infobars, and not permission prompts etc.
entry.content:
Per the proposal doc go/chrome-for-testing:infobars, `--disable-infobars` was meant to disable _all_ infobars (not just the CfT-specific one). This part is working fine.
However, it also seems to disable things that users wouldn’t generally consider to be infobars, such as permission prompts. **Anything using `InfoBarManager` gets disabled**, even if it’s not purely an informational bar.
The DevTools team ran into this when testing [local overrides](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/devtools/overrides#set-up) in a CfT build: http://chat/room/AAAA_2yvW2U/74qoKkKAYWs
We should find a way to only disable “informational infobars” and not permission prompts and potentially other non-informational uses of `InfoBar`s.

If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Improve PlzDedicatedWorker set up performance
entry.content:
PlzDedicatedWorker offloads script loads from renderer to browser. It make the renderer process free from downloading scripts etc. However, at the same time, it requires execution hops from the renderer to the browser, which can bring negative effects to performance.
This project is minimizing such performance penalty, and making Worker set up in parallel as much as possible to reduce overhead of PlzDedicatedWorker. Moreover, bringing performance win with PlzDedicatedWorker.

entry.title: [Chrome + macOS] Pasting text/html content leads to wrong interpretation as ASCII by macOS apps
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create any content that has non-ASCII chars (e.g. Japanese) in a WYSIWYG editor, like https://ckeditor.com/ckeditor-5/demo/feature-rich/ 2. Copy the content. 3. Paste it into an app in macOS (native Notes). 4. The content is malformed, ASCII chars.
# Problem Description Reported to the CKEditor 5 (https://github.com/ckeditor/ckeditor5/issues/16202)
It is affecting other rich-text editors, like: - Tiny (demo: https://www.tiny.cloud/) - ProseMirror (demo: https://prosemirror.net/) - Slate (demo: https://www.slatejs.org/examples/richtext)
Looks like Chrome no longer adds <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"> to the HTML, so it's interpreted as ASCII by other apps.
May be related: https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40945039
# Summary [Chrome + macOS] Pasting text/html content leads to wrong interpretation as ASCII by macOS apps
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>DataTransfer
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name:
Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: Crash in stable on Linux caused by a specific website
"sandbox" Content-Security-Policy header on service worker script results in insecure context
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Make a secure website that registers a Service Worker 2. Have the service worker file served with a "Content-Type: sandbox allow-scripts" header 3. Open console in Service Worker context, input "self.isSecureContext": result is false. Access to APIs such as IndexedDB is broken due to sandboxing.
I have made a repro case here: https://chrome-sw-csp-repro.glitch.me/ Click on the button to register the SW (it gives you a chance to open the inspector beforehand). The SW will log the value of "isSecureContext", which is false.
# Problem Description Setting a sandbox CSP header on a service-worker script results in it considered NOT a secure origin and APIs such as IndexedDB being blocked.
I'm not sure if this is a bug or an intended feature. A few clues make me believe that it's a bug: - Firefox and Safari do not act the same way - The parent's CSP does not affect the service worker, only the header on the SW file - The w3 spec says "Service Workers are always secure contexts" (https://www.w3.org/TR/secure-contexts/#examples-service-workers) . I interpret this as "isSecureContext should never be false".
On the other hand, I can see how sandboxing a service-worker can be desired, even though I could not find any documentation on what a CSP sandbox attribute should do on a service worker. MDN's documentation is more targeted towards iframes.
# Summary "sandbox" Content-Security-Policy header on service worker script results in insecure context
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>ServiceWorker
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Add V8 stand-alone win-arm64 debug compile bots
entry.content:
To prevent errors like: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5445337
Should compile on windows with: is_debug = true target_cpu = "arm64"
Then check that bots fail on commit: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/5443265
If by then the problem got fixed, we could manually revert the fix.
Let's add a pair of compile-only trybot and experimental bot for now. The experimental bot should then get promoted to a main bot blocking lkgr. The trybot can remain optional for now as we don't expect this to break often.

entry.title: nullderef in blink::OutOfFlowLayoutPart::SaveStaticPositionOnPaintLayer
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem poc.html
```html <html> <body> <script> var dialog = document.createElement("dialog") document.body.appendChild(dialog); dialog.showModal(); </script> </body> <head> <style> dialog { list-style-position: inside; text-orientation: mixed; }
html { position: absolute; container-type: inline-size; } </style> </head> </html> ```
1. fetch asan-linux-release-1278689 2. serve poc.html on port 8080 3. ./chrome http://127.0.0.1:8080/poc.html
# Problem Description tab crashed, see crash.log
# Summary nullderef in blink::OutOfFlowLayoutPart::SaveStaticPositionOnPaintLayer
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Layout
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Remove matmul conformance tests of 1D inputs
entry.content: To align with latest WebNN API Spec changes of `matmul` op which supports 2D+ inputs by https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/pull/523, we need to remove matmul conformance tests of 1D inputs.

entry.title: [Feature request] "Close tabs to the right" inside tab group should only apply to tabs in that group
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create multiple tab groups with many tabs in each of them 2. Collapse all groups except leftmost (so only titles will be visible) 3. Right click on a middle tab in the leftmost tab group 4. Click "Close tabs to the right"
# Problem Description In the described scenario, when only actual tabs I see are the ones in the group, I wanted to close part of the tabs in the group. However, when I clicked "Close tabs to the right" it closed not only the tabs I wanted, but 50 other tabs from other groups (everything that was to the right from the given group), requiring further many clicks to restore all of them.
I really liked that reopening closed tabs restored the groups as well. However, I believe it would be more intuitive for those group actions to affect tabs only inside a single group in the first place. To clarify - I'm okay with closing tab groups when action was initiated for top-level tab, but not for the one inside a group already.
Similarly, I would expect "in-group" behavior for "Close other tabs" as well
# Summary [Feature request] "Close tabs to the right" inside tab group should only apply to tabs in that group
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Tests are failing: profile_picker_view_test_utils.cc(241): Failed\nRunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_t...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): profile_picker_view_test_utils.cc(241): Failed\nRunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_base.cc:851.
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ManagedUserNoticeUIWindowPixelTest.InvokeUi_default/DarkTheme - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ManagedUserNoticeUIWindowPixelTest.InvokeUi_default/CR2023 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ManagedUserNoticeUIWindowPixelTest.InvokeUi_default/SmallWindow - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ManagedUserNoticeUIWindowPixelTest.InvokeUi_default/Regular - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ProfilePickerCreationFlowBrowserTest.CreateForceSignedInProfile
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/b1b6aa938c6f13d55c09cfbcfd27d9fc
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection
